description.other_details: NIH pain consortium, Pain Intensity Scales, http://painconsortium.nih.gov/pain_scales/index.html

details.purpose: Ein allgemeiner Archetyp zur Dokumentation von Symptomen und Informationen über diese Symptome. Er erlaubt die Aussage, dass der Patient nicht an diesem Symptom leidet (ohne weitere Informationen) oder auch genauere Aussage als erforderlich. Der Grund, dass eine allgemeine negative oder genauere Aussage gemacht werden kann ist, Fehler bezüglich der Vermehrung negative Aussagen über das Symptom und Einzelheiten zu einem deutlich positivem Symptom zu verhindern.
details.use: Zur Dokumentation von Informationen zu einem Symptom. Die Information kann kodiert oder strukturiert sein, falls dies erforderlich ist, oder aber die Freitextbeschreibung des Symptoms mit Einzelheiten als klinische Beschreibung nutzen.
details.misuse: Sollte nur für Symptome benutzt werden.

details.purpose: A generic archetype for recording symptoms and information about the symptoms. This archetype allows a statement to be made that the patient does not have this symptom (without any other information) or more detailed statements as required. The reason that a general negative statement can be made or a more detailed statement is to ensure that there is no possibility for error with negative statements about the symptom mixed with details of a symptom that is clearly positive.
details.use: For recording information about symptoms. The information can be coded and structured if required or utilise the free text description of the symptom with detail as clinical description if required.
details.misuse: This should only be used for symptoms. Specific symptoms such as pain may have their own specialisations, which should be used in preference.

translations.author: Jasmin Buck, Sebastian Garde
University of Heidelberg, Central Queensland University

items.items: das Symptom ist abwechselnd anwesend und nicht anwesend
das Symptom variiert deutlich, ist aber praktisch ständig anwesend

das Symptom ist allmählich über eine längere Zeitspanne hinweg aufgetaucht
die Art des Abklingens des Symptoms

ein Ereignis oder eine Handlung, die das Symptom verschlimmern
Information über einen bestimmten Faktor, der das Symptom verändert
ein Ereignis oder eine Handlung, die das Symptom verändert
*A score from 0 (not present) to 10 (as bad as it could be). Some scores use real numbers.(en)
die Dauer des Symptoms seit dem Beginn
Die Zeit (und/oder das Datum) der maximalen Stärke des Symptoms
die Anzahl wie oft das Symptom aufgetreten ist
*Features of the course of the symptom.(en)
die Person hat keine signifikanten Erfahrungen mit dem Symptom
die Entwicklung des Symptoms im Hinblick auf die Vergangenheit
*The symptom is decreasing in intensity over time.(en)
*The symptom has not changed over time.(en)
*The symptom is increasing in intensity over time.(en)
*The symptom is getting worse over time.(en)
*Measures of the intensity of the symptom. Assumed to represent current intensity. Left unbounded to allow maximum, minimum and average intensities to be recorded.(en)
Das Symptom wird durch diesen Faktor gelindert
Das Symptom wird durch diesen Faktor verbessert
Das Symptom wird durch diesen Faktor etwas verbessert
Das Symptom wird durch diesen Faktor nicht verändert
Das Symptom wird durch diesen Faktor etwas verschlechtert
Das Symptom wird durch diesen Faktor verschlechtert
Das Symptom wird durch diesen Faktor sehr viel verschlechtert

Ist dieses Symptom früher schon einmal aufgetreten
*Text description of the course of the symptom over time.(en)
*A features which would normally be expected but which is not present.(en)
*How the previous episode compares with this one (en)
*Structured details of symptoms in previous episodes (en)
*The scoring method used to assess the symptom. e.g Visual analog scale, text description.(en)
*Acute episode on background of lon-standing symptom.(en)
*Detail of the scoring method and results.(en)
*A text description of the symptom intensity.(en)
*The symptom is present on a cyclical basis.(en)
*The sympton is present on a seasonal basis.(en)
A symptom experienced by the patient.
The symptom is present at times and not at others.
The symptom varys considerably but is almost always present.
The nature of the onset of the symptom.
Over a longer period of time.
The nature of the cessation of the symptom.
An event or activity that brings on or triggers the symptom.
An event or activity that makes the symptom worse.
Information about a specific factor that changes the symptom.
An event or activity that modifies the symptom.
Other symptoms associated with this symptom.
A score from 0 (not present) to 10 (as bad as it could be). Some scores use real numbers.
The duration of the symptom since onset.
The time (and/or date) of maximum intensity of the symptom.
The number of times this symptom has occurred during this episode.
Features of the course of the symptom.
The person has not had any significant experience of the symptom.
Over a short period of time.
The progress of the symptom relative to the past.
The symptom has improved over time.
The symptom is decreasing in intensity over time.
The symptom has not changed over time.
The symptom is increasing in intensity over time.
The symptom is getting worse over time.
The symptom has resolved over time.
Measures of the intensity of the symptom. Assumed to represent current intensity. Left unbounded to allow maximum, minimum and average intensities to be recorded.
The symptom is relieved by this factor.
The symptom is made better by this factor.
The symptom is somewhat improved by this factor.
The symptom is not modified by this factor.
The symptom is made somewhat worse by this factor.
The symptom is made worse by this factor.
The symptom is made much worse by this factor.
Details of previous symptoms and comparison to this episode.
Have there been any previous episodes of this symptom?
Text description of the course of the symptom over time.
A features which would normally be expected but which is not present.
How the previous episode compares with this one.
Structured details of symptoms in previous episodes.
Details of locations in the body.
The scoring method used to assess the symptom. e.g Visual analog scale, text description.
Link to a previous record of this symptom.
Short-lived and/or rapid onset of symptoms.
Acute episode on background of lon-standing symptom.
Detail of the scoring method and results.
A text description of the symptom intensity.
The symptom is present on a cyclical basis.
The sympton is present on a seasonal basis.
The symptom presence or intensity fluctuates.
The symptom appears suddenly and dramatically.
